climbs.name: Martin's Shoulder
climbs.fa: Mitch Yaggie, Roy Suggett, & Marilla Lamb

content.description: Finding good gear placements would be the crux.  This line follows the shoulder the entire way before reaching the summit.
content.protection: See photo.  Bring lots of runners.
content.location: The line starts on the end of the shoulder on its west side.  It goes up an right before gaining the top of the shoulder and heading to the small col between the summits. A few more moves and you reach the main summit.

climbs.name: Fart'n Martin
climbs.fa: Marilla Lamb, Roy Suggett, & Mitch Yaggie

content.description: The start is meandering which enables you to gain access to gear, albeit a ways off the deck! Start on the wall moving up to traverse way right above the alcove then back left and into the crack for protection. Move up this crack heading left before mantling up to a crack heading right.  This will lead you to the col between the summits.  A few more moves will get you on top.
content.protection:
Passive = Tricams, Brown especially, Med. nuts

Active = BD .3,.4,.5 and a #1

Runners needed!  One 4' runner also.  You will find what you need on top.
content.location: In the middle of the west face of the tower just left of the alcove.
